sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
A plea for limited monarchy, as it was established in this nation, before the late war in an humble addresse to His Excellency, General Monck / by a zealot for the good old laws of his country, before any faction or caprice, with additions. L'Estrange, Roger, Sir, 1616-1704.
8 p.
Printed by T. Mabb for William Shears ..., London : 1660.
Attributed to Sir Roger L'Estrange. cf. NUC pre-1956. Copy at reel 944:24 has variant imprint. Reproductions of original in Huntington Library (reel 944:24) and Corpus Christi College (University of Oxford). Library (reel 2980:32).
=======
A plea for limited monarchy, as it was established in this nation, before the late war in an humble addresse to His Excellency, General Monck / by a zealot for the good old laws of his country, before any faction or caprice, with additions. L'Estrange, Roger, Sir, 1616-1704.
8 p.
Printed by T. Mabb for William Shears ..., London : 1660.
Attributed to Sir Roger L'Estrange. cf. NUC pre-1956. Copy at reel 944:24 has variant imprint. Reproductions of original in Huntington Library (reel 944:24) and Corpus Christi College (University of Oxford). Library (reel 2980:32).
